label: Current Ability
desc: Overall skill level of the driver at the moment

label: Potential Ability
desc: Maximum ability the driver can realistically reach in their career

label: Pace
desc: Raw speed and lap time potintial in race conditions

label: Qualifying
desc: One-lap pace under pressure in qualifying sessions

label: Start & Launch
desc: Skill at race starts, reaction off the line, and gaining positions early

label: Racecraft
desc: Ability to overtake, defend, and position the car in wheel-to-wheel battles

label: Wet Pace
desc: Performance and control in wet or mixed conditions

label: Consistency
desc: Ability to deliver stable lap times and avoid mistakes over a full race

label: Tire Management
desc: skill in conserving tyre wear and extending stints

label: Race Intelligence
desc: decision-making during races: strategy awareness, risk vs reward

label: Technical Feedback
desc: Ability to give useful feedback to engineers for car setup and development

label: Adaptability
desc: How quickly the driver adjusts to new cars, tracks, or changing conditions

label: ERS/Fuel Management
desc: Efficiency in using hybrid systems, battery, and fuel across a race

label: Mentality
desc: Mental toughness: focus, determination, and ability to recover from setbacks

label: Agression
desc: How forceful the driver is in battkes; higher values mean bolder but riskier moves

label: Crash Likelihood
desc: Tendency to make errors leading to incidents or retirements

label: Pressure Handling
desc: Ability to stay calm and deliver under high-pressure situations

label: Leadership
desc: Influence on the team: motivating staff, leading car development direction

label: Team Player
desc: Willingness to cooperate with teammates and support team goals

label: Car Development Impact
desc: Effectiveness at improving the car through feedback and testing

label: Reputation
desc: How highly the driver is regarded by fans, media, and the paddock
